findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract admin has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens if misused.

findings.title: SC - Stops Claims
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop users from claiming their tokens by setting the `lockPeriod` to a very big number or setting the `maxSupply` to a value very close or equal to the total supply, preventing users from claiming their tokens.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized to reduce gas consumption and improve performance.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract is using variables that initialize them only in the constructor and are not mutated by other functions. These variables should be declared as `immutable` to allow Solidity compiler optimizations, reducing storage and computation requirements and making the contract more gas-efficient.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide is a set of guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract. They are often used to notify external parties or clients about events that have occurred within the contract, such as the transfer of tokens or the completion of a task.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured from user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
